cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 325 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WSW tonight, forecast to turn WNW on Wednesday and then NW/N across the Florida Peninsula toward southern Georgia Thursday–Thursday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: East-central Florida coast (likely between Boca Raton and the Flagler/Volusia County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Bonita Beach to the Ochlockonee River FL (tropical-storm); Anclote River FL to Indian Pass FL (storm-surge)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None affecting the west-central Florida coast at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Florida Peninsula and Florida Gulf coast, including Tampa Bay and adjacent counties
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 mph with higher gusts) possible late Wed night into Thu, peak probabilities 25% for onset, 53% cumulative
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in Tampa Bay and along the west-central FL coast with onshore flow late Wed–Thu
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with local 6-8″ pockets; flash and urban flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat as rainbands sweep across the peninsula; dangerous rip currents and rough seas in and near the entrance channel
